question_details.resolution_criteria:
The question will resolve to YES if either the Chinese government or US intelligence community publicly announces a Chinese military base in a BRICS country before January 1st, 2026.

The country needs to be an official member of BRICS, thus the seven new nations that were invited in August 2023 will count towards YES only after January 2024, when they're projected to officially join.

If the Chinese base is in a country which only afterwards joins BRICS, the question will still resolve to YES.
question_details.fine_print:
US intelligence community's announcement requires a "high likelihood of Chinese operated base". In the event of numerical announcement (which is unlikely), "high likelihood" means a confidence of 90% or more.

The base needs to be projected to operate indefinitely, meaning that the Chinese operating a military base for the duration of temporary exercises (<1 year) do not count towards YES.

Naval bases and a military airfields both count as military bases.

Announcement from Pentagon or a US government institution of equal significance (e.g. White House) counts as Intelligence Community announcement.
